personalInfo.name: Regine Aniban, Adv Dip IT
personalInfo.title: Business Analyst (CX & Agentic AI)
personalInfo.summary: Customer Experience and Business Analyst professional with 13+ years across technical support, customer service, and business analysis. Adept at bridging customer needs with business and technical requirements to deliver effective, scalable solutions. Skilled in incident management, requirements gathering, process analysis, and stakeholder collaboration. Recognised for service excellence, analytical thinking, and simplifying complex issues. Currently focused on AI-driven business analysis and CX transformation, leveraging conversational AI, automation, and data insights to enhance user journeys and outcomes.
personalInfo.elevator_pitch: I'm a Business Analyst specialising in customer experience and agentic AI. With 13+ years spanning technical support, service excellence, and business analysis, I bridge business and technical needs to design efficient processes and AI-powered solutions that elevate customer journeys.

professional_background.question: Could you tell me about your professional background and key areas of expertise?
professional_background.answer: I have over 13 years of combined experience in customer service, technical support, and business analysis. In my recent roles, I've focused on bridging customer needs with business and technical requirements to deliver scalable solutions. My expertise includes requirements gathering, process analysis, CX journey mapping, and stakeholder management. I also bring strong documentation skills, having authored SOPs, knowledge base content, and functional specifications. More recently, I've been expanding into AI-driven customer experience, particularly in conversational AI and automation, to drive transformation and enhance user engagement.

professional_background.question: What is your approach to managing complex projects?
professional_background.answer: I start by clarifying business objectives and ensuring all stakeholders are aligned on the expected outcomes. From there, I break the project into manageable phases, mapping out requirements, risks, and dependencies. I rely on structured documentation, clear communication, and agile principles to stay flexible as needs evolve. Throughout, I focus on maintaining stakeholder engagement, ensuring progress is transparent, and risks are addressed early.

professional_background.question: How do you handle conflicting priorities or stakeholder requirements?
professional_background.answer: I take a collaborative approach—first by actively listening to each party's needs and constraints, then by analysing the underlying business drivers. I use impact assessments to show trade-offs and facilitate evidence-based decision-making. If alignment isn't immediate, I work to find a compromise that prioritises business goals while keeping customer impact in mind. My role is to bridge the gap between technical feasibility and business value.

experience_achievements.question: What has been your most challenging project, and how did you handle it?
experience_achievements.answer: One of the most challenging projects was supporting the launch of the Help & Support feature on Etisalat's mobile app. It required consolidating knowledge, aligning cross-functional teams, and ensuring accuracy in both English and Arabic. I facilitated workshops, standardised SOPs, and streamlined knowledge transfer. By focusing on clear documentation and stakeholder collaboration, we successfully launched on time, which improved self-service adoption and reduced support demand.

experience_achievements.question: Can you describe a situation where you improved a business process significantly?
experience_achievements.answer: At Asurion, I redesigned the complaint management process by mapping customer journeys and identifying bottlenecks. I introduced new SOPs, trained frontline staff, and aligned escalation paths with program managers and IT teams. This not only reduced resolution times but also improved consistency in handling customer issues. It was recognised through the Asurion Ambassador Award in 2024 for service excellence.

experience_achievements.question: Tell me about a time when you had to influence stakeholders to adopt your recommendations?
experience_achievements.answer: When I identified inefficiencies in Etisalat's knowledge base, some managers were hesitant to standardise content due to perceived effort. I prepared a business case highlighting reduced handling times, increased accuracy, and cost savings from fewer escalations. By showing measurable benefits and piloting the new approach with one team, I gained their trust and scaled the initiative across departments.

methodologies_tools.question: What methodologies do you use for business analysis and process improvement?
methodologies_tools.answer: I primarily use Agile methodologies for iterative requirements gathering and user story development, but I also apply elements of Waterfall when projects demand structured documentation. For process improvement, I use process mapping, root cause analysis, and Lean principles to identify inefficiencies and optimise workflows.

methodologies_tools.question: Which tools and technologies do you commonly use in your work?
methodologies_tools.answer: I've worked extensively with CRM systems, Jira, Confluence, and knowledge base platforms. For process documentation, I use Visio, Lucidchart, and draw.io for workflows. I also leverage Excel for data analysis and reporting. More recently, I've been hands-on with AI tools—building conversational AI prototypes using OpenAI APIs, Upstash Vector DB, and Vercel AI SDK, which gave me real-world experience in agentic AI workflows.

methodologies_tools.question: How do you approach requirements gathering and documentation?
methodologies_tools.answer: I begin by engaging stakeholders through interviews, workshops, and surveys. I then create user stories, process flows, and mock-ups to validate understanding. Documentation is always clear, concise, and tailored to the audience—technical for developers, but simplified for business stakeholders. I also ensure requirements are traceable, linking back to business objectives.

soft_skills.question: How do you handle difficult conversations with stakeholders?
soft_skills.answer: I approach them with empathy and preparation. I focus on understanding their concerns, backing up discussions with data or analysis, and keeping the conversation solution-focused. By maintaining transparency and professionalism, I can turn potential conflicts into opportunities for collaboration.

soft_skills.question: What's your approach to mentoring team members?
soft_skills.answer: I believe in leading by example and creating a supportive environment where team members feel comfortable asking questions. I provide structured guidance—such as walkthroughs of documentation standards or analysis techniques—while also encouraging independent problem-solving. I share lessons learned from my own career to help them avoid common pitfalls.

soft_skills.question: How do you ensure effective communication across different departments?
soft_skills.answer: I adapt my communication style to the audience. For executives, I provide concise summaries highlighting risks and outcomes. For technical teams, I share detailed requirements and workflows. Regular touchpoints, clear documentation, and active listening ensure alignment across departments.

problem_solving.question: How do you approach solving complex business problems?
problem_solving.answer: I break problems down into smaller components, conduct root cause analysis, and validate assumptions with stakeholders. I then explore multiple solutions, weighing feasibility against business value, before recommending the best option. Testing and iteration are key to ensuring the solution is practical and sustainable.

problem_solving.question: Can you describe how you've driven innovation in your previous roles?
problem_solving.answer: Most recently, I designed a Digital Twin AI-powered portfolio as a personal project, allowing recruiters to interact with my career profile via chat, voice, or phone. This showcased not only innovation but also how AI can transform customer and stakeholder engagement. Similarly, in my professional roles, I've introduced journey mapping and process automation ideas to optimise service delivery and improve CX.

problem_solving.question: What's your methodology for identifying and mitigating risks?
problem_solving.answer: I start by identifying risks through stakeholder discussions, historical data, and process reviews. I then assess each risk in terms of impact and likelihood, documenting them in a risk register. For mitigation, I propose preventive actions and contingency plans, ensuring accountability is assigned. Continuous monitoring and review are key to adjusting strategies as projects evolve.

business_analysis.question: Tell me about a time when you had to manage conflicting stakeholder requirements.
business_analysis.answer: At Asurion, I managed the complaint resolution process which involved multiple stakeholders including customers, technical teams, and management. I achieved 100% SLA compliance while improving efficiency by 35% by implementing clear communication channels, documenting requirements systematically, and ensuring all stakeholders' needs were addressed in the final solution.

business_analysis.question: How do you ensure the quality of your deliverables?
business_analysis.answer: I follow a comprehensive approach to quality assurance, as demonstrated at Asurion where I conducted UAT and created detailed SOPs. My process includes thorough documentation, stakeholder review cycles, and systematic testing. This approach contributed to achieving 100% SLA compliance and earning the Asurion Ambassador Award for service excellence.

customer_experience.question: How do you approach customer journey mapping?
customer_experience.answer: My approach to journey mapping is data-driven and customer-centric, as demonstrated at Asurion where I managed end-to-end support for product and service complaints. I focus on identifying pain points and opportunities for improvement. For example, at e& by Etisalat, I helped launch the Help & Support app feature by mapping customer journeys, which resulted in a 50% reduction in direct agent contact while maintaining high customer satisfaction.

customer_experience.question: Tell me about a time when you improved a customer experience process.
customer_experience.answer: At e& by Etisalat, I identified opportunities to improve the FAQ resolution process through detailed analysis and customer feedback. By implementing optimized knowledge management and training frontline staff, we achieved an 80% improvement in FAQ resolution time. This project demonstrated my ability to analyze processes, implement solutions, and measure outcomes effectively.

technical_skills.question: What tools and technologies are you proficient in?
technical_skills.answer: I'm proficient in several key BA and CX tools: Advanced in Excel and intermediate in Power BI for data analysis and reporting, experienced with CRM systems including Horizon Console One and Siebel, skilled in documentation tools like Confluence and SharePoint, familiar with Jira for project tracking, and recent experience with AI tools including RAG pipelines and conversational AI.

technical_skills.question: How do you approach process analysis and optimization?
technical_skills.answer: I take a systematic approach to process analysis, combining data analysis with stakeholder input. At Asurion, I improved efficiency by 35% through careful analysis of existing processes, identification of bottlenecks, and implementation of streamlined workflows. I use tools like Excel and Power BI for data analysis and ensure all process changes are properly documented and communicated to stakeholders.

project_management.question: Tell me about a challenging project you managed and how you ensured its success.
project_management.answer: At e& by Etisalat, I led the implementation of the Help & Support app feature, a challenging project that required coordination across multiple teams. The key challenges included managing diverse stakeholder expectations, ensuring comprehensive knowledge base coverage, and training frontline staff on new processes. I overcame these challenges through regular stakeholder workshops, clear communication, systematic documentation, and comprehensive training programs. The result was a 50% reduction in direct agent contact and 80% improvement in FAQ resolution time.
